text: A family of serine proteases expressed exclusively in myelo-monocytic cells specifically processes the nuclear factor-kappa B subunit <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vitro and may impair human immunodeficiency virus replication in these cells .
Two groups of U937 promonocytic cells were obtained by limiting dilution cloning which differed strikingly in their ability to support human immunodeficiency virus 1 ( HIV-1 ) replication .
" Plus " clones replicated the virus efficiently , whereas " minus " clones did not .
We examined these clones for differences in nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappa B activity which might account for the observed phenomenon .

Stimulation of plus clones liberated the classical <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> complex from cytoplasmic pools , whereas minus clones produced an apparently novel , faster - migrating complex , as judged by electrophoretic mobility shift assays .

text: It is surprising that the faster - migrating complex was composed also of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
However , the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> subunit was COOH-terminally truncated , as shown by immunoprecipitation .

The truncation resulted from limited proteolysis of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> during cellular extraction which released particular lysosomal serine proteases , such as elastase , <extra_id_0> cathepsin G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> proteinase 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

These specific proteases are coordinately expressed and were present exclusively in the minus U937 clones , but not in the plus clones , as demonstrated in the case of <extra_id_0> cathepsin G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In addition , these proteases were detected in certain subclones of THP-1 and HL-60 cells and in primary monocytes , in each case correlating with the truncated from of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
We demonstrate in vitro cleavage of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by purified elastase and <extra_id_0> cathepsin G <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
It is possible that particular serine proteases may have inhibiting effects on the replication of HIV-1 in myelo-monocytic cells .
The data also demonstrate that special precautions must be taken when making extracts from myelo-monocytic cells .
